test-case.name: K2-Serialization-1
test-case.description: A standalone attribute node cannot be serialized.

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-2
test-case.description: An attribute node appearing after an element cannot be serialized.

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-3
test-case.description: An attribute node appearing before an element cannot be serialized.

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-4
test-case.description: An attribute node appearing between two element nodes cannot be serialized.

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-5
test-case.description: Ensure that CR, NEL and LINE SEPARATOR in text nodes are escaped when serialized.

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-6
test-case.description: Ensure that CR, NL, TAB, NEL and LINE SEPARATOR in attributes are escaped when serialized.

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-7
test-case.description: Use characters in a text node that in XML 1.0 are invalid, and in XML 1.1 must be escaped. #x1 - #x1F

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-7a
test-case.description: Use characters in a text node that in XML 1.0 are invalid, and in XML 1.1 must be escaped. #x1 - #x1F

modified.change: separate out XML 1.0 version of test

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-8
test-case.description: Use characters in an attribute node that in XML 1.0 are invalid, and in XML 1.1 must be escaped. #x1 - #x1F

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-8a
test-case.description: Use characters in an attribute node that in XML 1.0 are invalid, and in XML 1.1 must be escaped. #x1 - #x1F

modified.change: separate out XML 1.0 version of test

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-9
test-case.description: Use characters in the range of #x7F through #x9F in an attribute node and ensure they are escaped properly. #x7F - #x9F

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-10
test-case.description: Use characters in the range of #x7F through #x9F in a text node and ensure they are escaped properly. #x7F - #x9F

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-11
test-case.description: Ensure a new-line character is properly escaped.

modified.change: allow \r\n in serialized result - see bug 20647

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-12
test-case.description: Write out elements and attributes that have the same names except for their prefixes. (Note by MHK: this is not really a serialization test.)
test-case.test: <e> <a:a xmlns:a="http://www.example.com/A" a:a="value"/> <b:a xmlns:b="http://www.example.com/A" b:a="value"/> </e>

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-13
test-case.description: Test item-separator property

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-14
test-case.description: Test item-separator property

modified.change: escape vertical bar in regex (was passing for the wrong reason)

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-15
test-case.description: Test item-separator property

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-16
test-case.description: Test item-separator property

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-17
test-case.description: Test omit-xml-declaration property

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-18
test-case.description: Test omit-xml-declaration property

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-20
test-case.description: Test XML 1.1 serialization with undeclare-prefixes

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-21
test-case.description: Test XML 1.1 serialization with undeclare-prefixes

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-22
test-case.description: Test standalone=yes property

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-23
test-case.description: Test standalone=no property

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-24
test-case.description: Test standalone=omit property

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-25
test-case.description: Test indent and suppress-indentation properties

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-26
test-case.description: Test suppress-indentation as lexical QName

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-27
test-case.description: Test suppress-indentation as EQName. (Note: assumes resolution of bug #28486)

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-28
test-case.description: Test suppress-indentation as a lexical QName using default namespace. (Note: assumes resolution of bug #28486)

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-29
test-case.description: Test whitespace in serialization parameters. (Note: assumes resolution of bug #28486)

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-30
test-case.description: Test cdata-section-elements property with lexical QName

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-31
test-case.description: Test cdata-section-elements property with default element namespace

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-32
test-case.description: Test cdata-section-elements property with EQName

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-33
test-case.description: Test cdata-section-elements property with interspersed comments

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-34
test-case.description: Test cdata-section-elements property with interspersed delimiter

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-35
test-case.description: Test cdata-section-elements property with interspersed unencodable character

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-36
test-case.description: Test that indent = true is accepted (bug 29703)

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-37
test-case.description: Test that indent = 1 is accepted (bug 29703)

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-38
test-case.description: Test omit-xml-declaration property set to "false" (bug 29703)

test-case.name: K2-Serialization-39
test-case.description: Test omit-xml-declaration property set to "0" (bug 29703)

test-case.name: Serialization-xml-01
test-case.description: Test the XML serialization output method - non-empty array

test-case.name: Serialization-xml-02
test-case.description: Test the XML serialization output method - empty map

test-case.name: Serialization-xml-03
test-case.description: Test the XML serialization method - use parameter file - use-character-map (Saxon bug 3729)

test-case.name: Serialization-xml-04
test-case.description: Test the XML serialization method - use parameter file - explicit declaration overrides parameter document
